alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 6:29PM CST until further notice by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana...Mississippi... Pearl River Near Pearl River affecting Hancock County, Pearl River County, and St. Tammany Parish. Pearl River Near Bogalusa affecting Washington Parish and Pearl River County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pearl River near Pearl River. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, When the river is falling, water on low lying property and over the lower portions of streets in River Gardens Subdivision will slowly begin to drain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.9 feet tomorrow morning then will hold steady near 16.9 feet.. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 1230 PM CST.
